title: West Lafayette, Indiana
summary: West Lafayette (/ˌlɑːfiːˈɛt, ˌlæf-/) is a city in Wabash Township, Tippecanoe County, Indiana, United States,[6] about 65 miles (105 km) northwest of the state capital of Indianapolis and 113 miles (182 km) southeast of Chicago. West Lafayette is directly across the Wabash River from its sister city, Lafayette.  As of the 2020 census, its population was 44,595.[7]  It is the most densely populated city in Indiana and is home to Purdue University.
